result.execSummary:
On one or more charges in this case, Natasha R Hill was found not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect. The defendant was found guilty of actually committing the crime(s) charged, but was also found not to be legally responsible under Wis. Stats. 971.165 for committing the crime(s) because of the defendant's mental condition. The legal effect of a finding of not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect is that the court must commit the defendant to the custody of the Department of Health and Family Services.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Certification of TRIAL transcript commencing 12/21/15 received and filed. (63 Pages.)
Copy of transcript forwarded to: Atty Steve Cain, W62 N588 Washington Ave Ste 201, Cedarburg, WI 53012
Invoice forwarded to Account Payable in the amount of $312.50 for Dr Mary Kay Luiz for service on 12-21-2015. Copy in File.
Order for Placement, filed and signed by the Court.

Defendant Natasha R Hill in court with attorney Virginia m Stuller.  Defendant Natasha R Hill in custody.  James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Court Trial proceeded.  Sworn for the state:  Christine G.  Sworn for defense: Dr. Mary Kay Luzi, Dr. Kelly Davis.  The Court took notice of the Criminal Complaint and Doctor's report filed October 6, 2015.    State and defense rest.  Testimony closed.  Arguments heard by state and defense.  The Court ordered the defendant to Department of Health Services to serve a 4 year commitment at Winnebago, with credit for 249 days time served, Order signed and filed.
Invoide forwarded to Accounts Payable in the amount of $1250.00 to Behavioral Consaltants INC for service on 09-20-2015,10-02-2015. Copy in file.

Defendant Natasha R Hill in court with attorney Virginia m Stuller.  Defendant Natasha R Hill in custody.  James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

AS TO COUNTS 1 & 2:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if she is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty.  Judgment of conviction was withheld.  Firearms/body armour warning given.  Voting admonishment given.  DNA notification given.   Parties requests court trial for the NGI plea.  The Court ordered case adjourned for court trial in Branch 26.  Court trial scheduled for December 21, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Natasha R Hill in court with attorney Virginia m Stuller.  Defendant Natasha R Hill in custody.  Tyrone Martin St. Junior for James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Matter in court for Doctor's report return.  It is the examiner's opinion that available information weighs in favor of an exculpatory mental disease and defendant's plea.  The state challenges the report.  The defendant does not challenge the report.    Court ordered case adjourned for motion hearing in Branch 26.  Motion hearing scheduled for October 29, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Received and filed.  Parties notified for pickup.

Court is advised by the defense a plea of not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect is entered on behalf of her client.  Pursuant to Sec. 971.16 Wisconsin Statutes, Court ordered defendant examined by the Forensic Unit.  Order for Examination, signed and filed.    Court ordered case adjourned for doctor's report return in Branch 26.
